results.title: 26 times in a row
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Labrecque, ONF | NFB and Jacques Bobet
results.brief_description: The Marathon has become a symbol of the Olympics. A modern-day addition to the Games, it commemorates the soldier who ran cross-country, in 490 B.C., to announce the Greek victory at Marathon and then died. Excellent film footage of the 1976 Olympic Marathon documents the physical demands of the race. Its emotional counterpart is related by Cierpinski, the event’s 1976 gold medalist. This emotion-charged film proves that although the winner of the Decathlon is the best all-round athlete, the “toughest” is the winner of the Marathon. (Award: Portland)

results.title: 26 Bathrooms
results.brief_description: Peter Greenaway uses visual imagery to present this warm and humorous look at people and their bathrooms, revealing that the bathroom is used for far more than the daily duties of cleanliness and hygiene. We see people soaking, dozing, eating, reading, chatting and watching television in surroundings that range from plain porcelain to the “Samuel Beckett Memorial Bathroom”.

results.title: 250 million years ago: permian life in Australia
results.creator_credit: Australian Museum, Harold Fletcher and Lex Halliday
results.brief_description: The permian deposits found most notably in the Kimberley’s, North-West Basin and the Hunter Valley are some of the world’s richest fossil deposits. Mostly marine, but some fresh-water and land strata fossils are included. Typical fossils such as butterfly shells, starfish, lace coral, as well as plants and coal seams are highlighted.
results.title_for_label: 250 million years ago: permian life in Australia

results.title: 25 years of International Air Tattoo
results.brief_description: In 1996 the International Air Tattoo celebrated its Silver Jubilee. From humble beginnings, as a small airshow at North Weald airfield in 1971, the Tattoo progressed to become an annual event of international stature, staged to support the ongoing work of the Royal Air Force Benevolent Fund. Today, the International Air Tattoo is the biggest multinational gathering of military aircraft in the world. Using recent and archival footage, this tape captures the achievements and history of a movement that has sparked international attention and involvement. Written and narrated by Sean Maffett.

results.title: 25 Firemens Street = Tuzolto Utca 25 [NTSC]
results.brief_description: The history of Hungary, just prior to, during and after WWII, is related through the recollections of the inhabitants of an old house, over the course of one hot night, on the eve of its demolition. Szabo employs a fragmentary, non-chronological, flashback structure to convey public and private events stretching over forty years. This important film by Szabo is an incisive account of human perception, memory and horror, told in poetic and ironic terms. Cast includes Rita Bekes, Lucyna Winnicks and Peter Muller. In Hungarian with English subtitles.

results.title: 240 Volts
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum and St John Ambulance Australia
results.brief_description: How to deal with accidents caused by electrical appliances. Firstly turn the power off at the switch. Electrical shocks often cause the heart to stop and is therefore the need for immediate cardiac compression and resuscitation. Shows how to apply exterior ‘heart massage’ and mouth to mouth resuscitation which can save lives.

results.title: 24 = Twenty-four Season one [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Cyrus Yavneh, Kiefer Sutherland, Norman S Powell, Andrea Newman, Michael Loceff, Imagine Entertainment (US), Twentieth Century-Fox Television, Imagine Television, Real Time Productions, Jon Cassar, Rodney Charters, Davis Guggenheim, Stephen Hopkins, Frederick King Keller, Winrich Kolbe, Paul Shapiro, Bryan Spicer, Ian Toynton and James Whitmore Jr
results.brief_description: When “24” was launched on US television it became an immediate cult success. Using real-time it explores the activities of a Counter Terrorist Unit in Los Angeles as they work against the clock combating sophisticated crimes. Features split screens, multiple narrative threads and the latest technology, displaying the tension and complexity of dealing with crimes that span the globe. In series one, set on the day of the California Presidential Primary elections, Jack Bauer and his staff discover an attempt will be made on politician David Palmer’s life. Whilst battling to foil the assassination, Jack suspects that a double-crosser is working within the CTU. Meanwhile Jack’s daughter has snuck out of the house, and is missing, but unbeknownst to her she is a part of the intricate assassination plot. In other narrative threads, Teri Bauer, Jack’s estranged wife, tries to track down her daughter but is also in grave danger. Throughout the unravelling of the twenty-four hours, this drama is incredibly suspenseful, as the protagonists are put through major trauma, whilst dealing with death, murder, violence, blackmail, traitors and the complexity of terrorism and crime. Technology is a major part of the texture of the narrative here: mobile phones, electronic tracking devices, cameras, computers, satellites, the constant hacking and breaking of codes, all add to a sense that electronic machinery can be a menacing force, both friend and foe. But to the writers’ credit, the show also has a great deal of humanity - it ably captures the sense of foreboding, particularly for Jack, whose personal and professional life is compromised under extreme circumstances. Cast includes Kiefer Sutherland, Leslie Hope, Sarah Clarke, Elisha Cuthbert, Xander Berkeley, Dennis Haysbert and Penny Johnson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cyrus Yavneh, Kiefer Sutherland, Norman S Powell, Andrea Newman, Michael Loceff, Imagine Entertainment (US), Twentieth Century-Fox Television, Imagine Television, Real Time Productions, Jon Cassar, Rodney Charters, Davis Guggenheim, Stephen Hopkins, Frederick King Keller, Winrich Kolbe, Paul Shapiro, Bryan Spicer, Ian Toynton and James Whitmore Jr

results.title: 21 Up (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Margaret Bottomley, Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
In 1964 a number of seven year olds expressed their views on life, leisure, love, marriage, colour prejudice, education and money (SEVEN UP). At fourteen years of age they commented on their changing views (7 PLUS SEVEN). Now at twenty-one, using clips from these films, the program compares the responses of this group of individuals as they grow to adulthood. This film is recommended for Years 11-12 and Tertiary level education.
